title: Given infinite time, and infinite number of possible attempts, how can one distinguish the outcomes of randomness from the outcomes of will? (I can't give definition of randomness and will, sorry, let's use common sense) - Quora

response.answer_text: You cannot do that just by looking at the outcomes. If you look at some dice on a table, there is no way telling which ones are normally rolled showing a random result and which ones are deliberately placed in their positions. To make the distinction you have to investigate the history of the outcomes, whether they are products of a random process or decided by someone.
